body: I can't test this on Bazel 8 yet.

We are on 7.6.1 and we are noticing that some files under `test.outputs` arenâ€™t being downloaded consistently. I need to debug more, but this being test output related makes me wonder if it has the same root cause.
I can reproduce the original issue on Bazel 8.2.1 on any Java test in the Bazel repo.

My issue wasn't this. My issue was a bad regex, but also the surprising behavior that all `test.outputs` files are downloaded for a failing test, regardless of `--remote_download_minimal`. I'll open a new issue.
This is a more general problem: changing `--remote_download_regex` isn't effective if an action hits the action cache because `finalizeAction` is never called.

Nvm, this issue appears to be specific to `test.xml` since it is not an output of the test action, only of the test spawn. It's not clear to me how to wire this up in a good way since it's so special.

CC @coeuvre @tjgq

issue.title: Make `test.xml` a regular test action output

issue.body:
This ensures that BwoB correctly invalidates the action if `test.xml` is newly requested to be downloaded.

Fixes #25762
